intro: Aikinia carnosa, commonly known as the woolly aikinia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of red and yellow. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to rocky soils and full sun exposure. Aikinia carnosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
